Description: Lower body sherd of South Ionian pottery cup, probably a cup with everted rim; interior: wide black band and minimal reserved zone; exterior glazed black; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: Schlotzhauer identifies the sherd as possibly coming from a Type 9 or Type 5 South Ionian cup with everted rim. These cups coincide with Petrie’s class L1 (Petrie 1886, 18). The Type 9 shape evolved from the earlier Type 5 cup shape. Type 5 cups are few at Naukratis whereas there are numerous examples of Type 9 cups. Both types were common drinking vessels found in Greeks sanctuaries, including the sanctuary of Aphrodite at Miletus and the Sanctuary of Demeter and Kore at Tocra.
Bibliographic references: Schlotzhauer 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus Naukratis (p. 54, no. 5)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GE.096) (Phase 3)
